title: Business conditions improve, employment index up: NAB
text:
Business conditions have improved, driven by an uptick in trading, profitability, forward orders and employment intentions, suggesting the weakening trend since mid-2018 has now reached a gentle turning point.

The all important employment index, which the Reserve Bank of Australia monitors closely, edged up in September and is now above average.

Based on historical relationships, the survey suggests employment will

rise about 18,000 per month over the next six months – this is more than the survey suggested last month when it forecast a rate of 16,000 per month growth.

"This mirrors official data that shows ongoing strong employment growth but subdued consumer spending," NAB group chief economist Alan Oster said.

"While both conditions and confidence remain below average levels the broad-based trend decline since mid-2018 appears to have slowed."

While the latest NAB Business survey shows a marginal improvement in the key areas there are still serious concerns about whether the construction downturn and weak income growth will weigh on investment and employment.
